data.title: Carol Alene (Jackson) Walters
data.meta_description: Carol Alene (Jackson) Walters, 83, Duncansville, went home to be with the Lord on Sunday morning. She was surrounded by the love of family and caretakers. Carol was born in Duncansville, daughter of the late G. Louis and Dorothy (Hoover) Jackson. She was a 1959 graduate of Hollidaysburg High School and a 1962 graduate of […]
data.text:
She was a 1959 graduate of Hollidaysburg High School and a 1962 graduate of Altoona School of Nursing.

On Dec. 9, 1961, she married Wilford “Willy” Walters.

Carol served as a registered nurse in pediatrics and maternity at the Altoona Hospital for more than 30 years.

Surviving are two sons, Kevin (Robin) of Duncansville and Eli (Lauren) of State College; a daughter, Penny Hood (Brian) of Fort Washington; eight grandchildren: Gregory, Zachary, Geena, Jesse, Gabriel,

Evelyn, Benaiah and Victoria; many nieces and nephews; and her lifelong best friend, Laurel Snyder.

She was preceded in death by her husband of 55 years; seven siblings; and two children, Kerry and Peggy.

Carol was a member of Carson Valley Church of the Brethren, where she served as a Sunday school and Vacation Bible School teacher and a youth advisor.

She had a caretaker’s heart and served many through hospitality and practical and medical help. Carol was a devoted wife, mother and grandmother. Her greatest joys were spending time with her family and telling people about Jesus.

Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Wednesday, May 22, 2024, at Brown Funeral Home & Cremation Services Inc., Duncansville.

A funeral service will be held at 11 a.m. Thursday, May 23, 2024, at Carson Valley Church of the Brethren. Pastor Bradley Runkle will officiate. Interment will be at Carson Valley Cemetery.

In lieu of flowers, memorials may be made to Carson Valley Church of the Brethren, 122 Church Road, Duncansville.

BrownFuneralAndCremation.com
